intro: Burdachia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' burdachia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the summer months. Burdachia williamsii is often found in desert scrub and grassland environments.
